Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2009 04:44PM disneyfan wrote: Hi Krystyna,  After six years, I have reoccuring breast cancer that has bone and liver mets.  I also did not have any sysptoms.  I have over 30 mets in the liver and up and down the spine and ribs.  My arimidex also stopped working.  I am been trying Abaxane for chemo with avastin and zometa for the bones.  I have been told radiation can help with the bones mets but only aromotherapy or chemo will work on the liver mets.  I still do not have any pain systems for either by my blood work sure shows it.  I have to trust the chemo to shrink the liver mets and then do the hormone therapy.  Have faith.  I am believing that stage four cancer was a death sentence 10 years ago but now is like managing a chronic disease such as diabetes.   You have to get it under control and it will be okay for a while and then you get a bump in your levels and you then get it under control again.  Stage 4 breast cancer is manageble if found early enough.  Thankfully it has not gone to your brain or lungs.  Hopefully this has help.  Joanne
